intro: Diplotaxis catholica subsp. ibicensis, commonly known as the Iberian wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Spain and Portugal. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to Mediterranean climates. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific morphological features and geographic distribution.
